original_solution_mapping.L2: Of those only 180*.8=<<180*.8=144>>144 people showed up
original_solution_mapping.L3: So only 144-10=<<144-10=134>>134 got him gifts and hence need thank you cards.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2323.
    Returns: the number of thank you cards Jack needs.
    """
    # L1
    total_invitations = 200 # sent out 200 invitations
    rsvp_rate = 0.9 # 90% of people RSVPed
    num_rsvp = total_invitations * rsvp_rate

    # L2
    show_up_rate = 0.8 # 80% of people who RSVPed actually showed up
    num_showed_up = num_rsvp * show_up_rate

    # L3
    no_gift_attendees = 10 # 10 people who showed up didn't get a gift
    num_thank_you_cards = num_showed_up - no_gift_attendees

    # FA
    answer = num_thank_you_cards
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Of those only {num_rsvp}*{show_up_rate}=<<{num_rsvp}*{show_up_rate}={num_showed_up}>>{num_showed_up} people showed up
So only {num_showed_up}-{no_gift_attendees}=<<{num_showed_up}-{no_gift_attendees}={num_thank_you_cards}>>{num_thank_you_cards} got him gifts and hence need thank you cards.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Of those only 180*0.8=<<180*0.8=144>>144 people showed up
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So only 180-10=<<180-10=170>>170 got him gifts and hence need thank you cards.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_rsvp' (value: 180.0) was used instead of 'num_showed_up' (value: 144.0).
